diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Antiphospholipid-antibody syndrome with vascular thrombosis and infarction of the posterior mitral-valve papillary muscle, causing acute mitral regurgitation.
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with acute mitral regurgitation associated with fever, hematuria, and hemolysis. The transesophageal echocardiogram showed marked prolapse of the mitral valve leaflets, and assessments indicated an infarction of the papillary muscle. Positive serological tests for antiphospholipid antibodies confirmed the diagnosis of the antiphospholipid-antibody syndrome. The clinical presentation and imaging findings pointed away from other potential conditions like infectious or rheumatic causes.
